author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Rallies After Fed Shows Inflation Concern
text:
The U.S. dollar rose for a fourth consecutive day Wednesday after a release of the minutes of the Federal Reserveâ€™s January meeting showed central bankers are concerned about a quickening of inflation.
The Wall Street Journal Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, jumped 0.4% to 83.94. The currency has advanced 1.5% during the winning streak. The dollar serged 0.4% against the euro and the Japanese yen, and 0.6% versus the British pound.
